| 2049                                                                                                                                                                | Billing     | As a Billing Manager, I want negative balance invoices for companies '07' and '22' to have conditional logic that affects the data sent to Great Plains<br>When a Statement status is changed to Sent, we send a specific set of data to Great Plains.  The contents of that data payload depend on a few variables.<br>One of the variables is whether the Total Due for an Invoice within the statement is a positive or negative amount.  If the amount is negative for the Invoice, then the items on that invoice are sent to the Accounts Payable module in Great Plains.  This module is contacted by using the correct ""Map ID"" in the data payload eg: <tem:mapID>PMIMPV2</tem:mapID><br>Another variable is the GL Entity.  The GL Entity refers to the first two digits of the GL String value, and signifies which legal entity the customer site belongs to.  Towne Park has several legal entities under its brand umbrella due to various acquisitions of other competitors over the years.  All of these companies now belong to ""Towne Park"" brand, but for bookkeeping reasons some of them have to follow specific accounting rules in Great Plains that are unique to them.  In order to support this, we change some data in the data payload to Great Plains based on the GL Entity.  For example, if the GL String begins with '07', then that customer is an 'ENC' company customer.  If the GL String begins with '22', however, then that customer belongs to 'UPP'.  When the invoice is for one of these entities, we change the ""Company"" tag value in the data payload to Great Plains.  Eg: <COMPANY>ENC</COMPANY>  or  <COMPANY>UPP</COMPANY><br>Currently, there is a problem in production because when the invoice amount is negative, and we send it to the AP module in Great Plains (ie: the <tem:mapID>PMIMPV2</tem:mapID> map) we are correctly changing the COMPANY value, but we need to also change the  <tem:interID> value to match the company value.<br>Below are two examples of what we should see when the invoice amount is negative only:<br>For customers with GL String beginning with '22':<br><?xml version=""1.0"" encoding=""utf-8""?><br><soapenv:Envelope | 1981                                                                                                                                                                | Forecasting | As an Account Manager, I want my P&L View's Forecasted Internal Revenue to use Powerbill [FIXED FEE] data, so that I can observe financial trends of the sites for which I'm responsible.<br>User Flow<br>Account Manager navigates to the Forecasting module in the system<br>Account Manager selects a [FIXED FEE] site from their assigned locations<br>Account Manager selects the ""P&L View"" from the navigation menu<br>System retrieves deal structure information from Powerbill<br>System calculates Internal Revenue [FIXED FEE] component using appropriate formula with escalators<br>System combines all available Internal Revenue calculation outputs (based on deal types) and adds sum of Other Revenue tab from Forecast for each month<br>System displays the initialized P&L View with calculated Internal Revenue Forecast values<br>Data Element<br>Data Use Category<br>Example Formula<br>Example Queries / Notes<br>INTERNAL REVENUE<br>Budget<br>[INTERNAL REVENUE] = [BUDGET_CATEGORY_MONTHLY_TOTAL]*(-1)<br>SELECT SUM([BALANCE]) AS BUDGETED_CATEGORY_MONTHLY_TOTAL<br>FROM [TP_EDW].[dbo].[BUDGET_FINAL] AS budget<br>JOIN [TP_EDW].[dbo].[CHART_OF_ACCOUNT] AS coa ON budget.MAIN_ACCOUNT = coa.MAIN_ACCOUNT<br>WHERE [COST_CENTER] = '0170'<br>AND [PERIOD] = '202503'<br>AND [IS_SUMMARY_CATEGORY] = 'INTERNAL REVENUE'<br>------------------<br>BUDGETED_CATEGORY_MONTHLY_TOTAL<br>-279663.89000<br>INTERNAL REVENUE<br>Forecast<br>[INTERNAL REVENUE] = [FIXED FEE IR] + [PER OCCUPIED ROOM IR] + [PER LABOR HOUR IR] + [REVENUE SHARE IR] + [BILLABLE ACCOUNTS IR] + [MANAGEMENT AGREEMENT IR] + [OTHER REVENUE (from Forecast)]<br>WHERE<br>                [FIXED FEE IR] = [SUM OF POWERBILL FIXED FEES]  + [ESCALATORS]<br>                [PER OCCUPIED ROOM IR] = [PER OCCUPIED ROOM FEE] * [FORECASTED OCCUPIED ROOMS] + [ESCALATORS]<br>                [PER LABOR HOUR IR] = [FORECASTED HOURS PER JOB CODE (if configured)] * [POWERBILL BILLABLE RATE PER JOB CODE (Regular Rate Only)] + [ESCALATORS]<br>                [REVENUE SHARE IR] = [FORECASTED EXTERNAL REVENUE] * [POWERBILL REVENUE SHARE PERCENTAGE PER TIER] + [ESCALATORS (Including Threshold Escalators)]<br>                [BILLABLE ACCOUNTS IR] = [SUM OF ACCOUNT SUMMARY FOR NON-EXCLUDED BILLABLE ACCOUNTS]<br>                [MANAGEMENT AGREEMENT IR] = [MANAGEMENT AGREEMENT CONFIGURATION, REPLACING 'NET EXTERNAL REVENUE' WITH 'FORECASTED EXTERNAL REVENUE' AND REPLACING 'PAYROLL' WITH 'FORECASTED PAYROLL' AND REPLACING 'INSURANCE' WITH [5.77% of FORECASTED PAYROLL] + [BUDGET_FINAL AMOUNT IN 7082 (Vehicle Insurance Account)] + POWERBILL INSURANCE ADD'L AMOUNT'] + [OTHER EXPENSES FORECAST] + [SUM OF THE DELTA OF BILLABLE EXPENSE ACCOUNTS LIST COMPARED TO OTHER EXPENSES TAB ACCOUNTS LIST] + [ESCALATORS]<br>First we calculate the Internal Revenue per deal type in order to consider escalators and other deal-specific nuance, then we add all elements together along with anything entered in the 'Other Revenue' tab from the Forecast in order to find the final INTERNAL REVENUE per month (Forecast).<br>NOTE: Where escalators are involved, they only apply to the months following their trigger date.<br>NOTE: BILLABLE ACCOUNTS should only be considered a 'deal type' in cases WHERE [BILLABLE ACCOUNTS] = ENABLED AND [MANAGEMENT AGREEMENTS] = DISABLED<br> | 702                                                                                                                                                                 | Billing     | As a Billing Admin, I want to configure an automatic escalator for the Management Fee so that the fee will increase annually according to predefined terms without requiring manual adjustments each year.<br> <br>User Flow<br> <br>1. User navigates to the Management Agreement configuration page<br>2. User selects a Management Fee type (Fixed Fee, Per Labor Hour, or Revenue Percentage)<br>3. User checks the ""Enable Escalator"" checkbox<br>4. User selects an Escalation Month from the dropdown<br>5. User selects an Escalator Format (Percentage or Fixed Amount)<br>6. User enters the escalator value(s) based on the selected Management Fee type:<br>1. For Fixed Fee: User enters a percentage or fixed amount<br>2. For Per Labor Hour: User enters a percentage or fixed amount for each job code's standard and overtime rates<br>3. For Revenue Percentage: User enters a percentage or fixed amount<br>7. User saves the configuration<br> <br>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | Scenario 1: Enabling the Management Fee Escalator<br> <br>GIVEN I am on the Management Agreement configuration page<br>WHEN I select a Management Fee type<br>AND I check the ""Enable Escalator"" checkbox<br>THEN I should see the Escalation Month dropdown and Escalator Format options appear<br> <br>Scenario 2: Configuring Fixed Fee Escalator<br> <br>GIVEN I have enabled the Escalator for a Fixed Fee Management Fee<br>WHEN I select ""January"" as the Escalation Month<br>AND I select ""Percentage"" as the Escalator Format<br>AND I enter ""3%"" as the Escalator Percentage<br>THEN the system should save this configuration<br>AND display a tooltip explaining that the Fixed Fee will increase by 3% each January<br> <br> Scenario 3: Configuring Per Labor Hour Escalator<br> <br>GIVEN I have enabled the Escalator for a Per Labor Hour Management Fee<br>AND I have added two job codes<br>WHEN I select ""July"" as the Escalation Month<br>AND I select ""Fixed Amount"" as the Escalator Format<br>AND I enter ""$2.00"" as the Standard Rate Escalator for the first job code<br>AND I enter ""$3.00"" as the Overtime Rate Escalator for the first job code<br>AND I enter ""$1.50"" as the Standard Rate Escalator for the second job code<br>AND I enter ""$2.25"" as the Overtime Rate Escalator for the second job code<br>THEN the system should save this configuration<br>AND display tooltips explaining that the rates will increase by the specified amounts each July<br> <br> <br>Scenario 4: Configuring Revenue Percentage Escalator<br>  <br>GIVEN I have enabled the Escalator for a Revenue Percentage Management Fee<br>WHEN I select ""October"" as the Escalation Month<br>AND I select ""Percentage"" as the Escalator Format<br>AND I enter ""5%"" as the Escalator Percentage<br>THEN the system should save this configuration<br>AND display a tooltip explaining that the Revenue Percentage will increase by 5% each October<br> <br> <br>Scenario 5: Viewing Escalator Help Text<br>  <br>GIVEN I am on the Management Agreement configuration page with the Escalator enabled<br>WHEN I hover over the info icon next to the ""Enable Escalator"" checkbox<br>THEN I should see a tooltip explaining how the Escalator feature works<br>AND the tooltip should mention that for Arrears Billing Type, the escalator will increase the fee on the last Friday of the month preceding the Escalation Month<br>Fixed Fee Escalator<br> <br>Given a contract with Management Fee type set to ""Fixed Fee" |

| 701                                                                                                                                                                 | Billing     | As a Billing Admin, I want to add an escalator to the PTEB line item when using Percentage of Billable Payroll, so that the PTEB percentage automatically increases at predefined intervals to account for rising benefit costs.<br> <br>User Flow<br>1. User navigates to the Contract Details page<br>2. User expands the Billable Accounts section<br>3. User enables Billable Accounts if not already enabled<br>4. User scrolls to the PTEB section<br>5. User checks ""Create PTEB Line-item"" checkbox<br>6. User selects ""Charge as Percentage of Billable Payroll"" radio option<br>7. User checks ""Enable Escalator"" checkbox<br>8. User selects an Escalation Month from the dropdown<br>9. User selects an Escalator Format (Percentage or Fixed Amount)<br>10. User enters an escalator value:<br>1. If Percentage: User enters a percentage value (e.g., ""3%"") by which the PTEB percentage will increase<br>2. If Fixed Amount: User enters a percentage point value (e.g., ""2%"") that will be added to the PTEB percentage<br>11. User completes other required fields for the PTEB line item<br>12. User saves the contract configuration<br> <br> <br> <br>
